body_html:
@ringw I've been looking at image_ops in tf.contrib.image in tf 1.5 and it looks amazing! Thanks! I'm giving it a try now. 👍

What's definition of identity here in terms of a0, a1, ...? I assume all 0 except a0, b1, c2 == 1?

What do you think of a function identity_projective_transform()?

Identity makes setting up a function that uses these utilities a bit simpler to define and less error prone, since the actual transform function requires at least one transform to be defined as input. Of course rotate(0), etc is identity identity_projective_transform() would be just for clarity. :-)
body_text:
@ringw I've been looking at image_ops in tf.contrib.image in tf 1.5 and it looks amazing! Thanks! I'm giving it a try now. 👍
What's definition of identity here in terms of a0, a1, ...? I assume all 0 except a0, b1, c2 == 1?
What do you think of a function identity_projective_transform()?
Identity makes setting up a function that uses these utilities a bit simpler to define and less error prone, since the actual transform function requires at least one transform to be defined as input. Of course rotate(0), etc is identity identity_projective_transform() would be just for clarity. :-)
body:
@ringw I've been looking at [image_ops in tf.contrib.image](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/image/python/ops/image_ops.py) in tf 1.5 and it looks amazing! Thanks! I'm giving it a try now. :+1: 

What's definition of identity here in terms of `a0, a1, ...`? I assume all 0 except `a0, b1, c2 == 1`?

What do you think of a function `identity_projective_transform()`?

Identity makes setting up a function that uses these utilities a bit simpler to define and less error prone, since the actual transform function requires at least one transform to be defined as input. Of course `rotate(0)`, etc is identity `identity_projective_transform()` would be just for clarity. :-)
